programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (10/78)
programme.desc: Playing with Louise and her doll gives Mike an idea. He decides to stage a rescue mission with the doll from the roof of the Mikkelson's house so he can be a hero and impress Iris. But as he prepares to show Iris that he's a real-life superhero, the racoons arrive and ruin his plans. Mercury falls in love with the doll the minute he lays eyes on it while Freddy sets his sights on her sparkly tiara. Now Mike has a real rescue on his hands, all under Iris's watchful gaze. The stakes couldn't be higher!

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (11/78)
programme.desc: The racoons watch Mike enviously as he makes himself comfortable in his living room. If only they could get a piece of that sweet action. Then Freddy has an idea. He crashes into the bay window and pretends to be injured, forcing the Mikkelsens to take him in. Mike sees through the ruse immediately, but if he's going to unmask the scheming raccoon he's going to have to defeat the imposter without getting himself in trouble for fighting the poor "injured" Freddy.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (12/78)
programme.desc: Laura leaves her cell phone at home and Mike discovers a hilarious video of Fluffy on it that he absolutely has to show Iris. But the raccoons want to get their hands on the phone too and during an insane chase Fluffy scoops it up in her mouth and accidentally swallows it. Fluffy dashes around the house to escape the racoons and every time she gets bumped it sets off a new app. Will Mike ever get the phone back?

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (13/78)
programme.desc: Wanting to impress Iris, Mike slips his bowtie on and does his best James Bond impression. What a stud! Meanwhile the turtles are using Stephan's harpoon to go zip-lining and the raccoons see the perfect chance to break in and get their loot out discreetly. Now Mike has an opportunity to act like a real secret agent. can he live up to it?

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 2 (7/78)
programme.desc: If an injured Tom hasn't gotten better before Rick and Ginger leave for their weekend getaway, Tom will be forced to stay at the Jolly Friends Pet Oasis -- which is anything but jolly for Tom. Jerry goes to great lengths to tempt Tom into doing anything but rest; after all, a weekend without Tom is a holiday for Jerry.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 2 (1/78)
programme.desc: Ginger brings home a kitten that she will foster until she finds it a forever home. Everyone in the house falls in love with the kitten, except for Tom. When Spike and Jerry see that Tom has become a bad influence on the kitten, a dragged-out fight ensues. The only thing that ends it is the news that the kitten has a new home.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 2 (9/78)
programme.desc: Tom, Jerry and Butch watch a Smack-n-Cheese Cheesy Cheese Puffs commercial and when they hear the words "Supplies are running out," the trio's rivalry reaches new heights as they compete to get what they imagine to be the very last bag of the snack food.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 2 (10/78)
programme.desc: Jerry's Uncle Harry is coming for a visit. Tuffy's excited to meet the Great Uncle he has heard so much about. Harry craves a respite from his life as a nomad on the party cruise ship circuit, but it doesn't take him long to realize that life on the high seas has its advantages -- specifically, not being holed up with Tom!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 2 (11/78)
programme.desc: Toodles' folks are coming for a visit. The problem is, they think she's married with kittens. Tom happily plays the role of husband and volunteers Jerry and Tuffy to play their adorable kittens. Complications ensue when Toodles' dad doesn't take to Tom; her mom coddles Jerry and Tuffy a little too much; and Toodles' ex-boyfriend, Butch, learns that his girl "got hitched."

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 2 (14/78)
programme.desc: After Jerry mocks up a "Reward If Found" poster for Tom with the address of a neighbor with a ferocious dog, some good Samaritans bring Tom "home." Now, Tom has to escape from the house with his nine lives intact before he's brought back again and again.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (37/78)
programme.desc: Just as Grizzy settles into the couch by the fireside, the Lemmings come charging into the living room on their new mount, the vacuum cleaner. Irritated, the bear throws the mechanical charger into the fireplace, which blows up. Freezing air sweeps into the cabin. Seeking a source of heat, Grizzy decides to move into the science station greenhouse where the temperature is controlled by a drone. But the bear is unaware of what he carries in his luggage: the Lemmings!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (38/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings have a new playmate: a walrus! The rodents ride the creature throughout the cabin, then make him slide down the roof before starting all over again. Grizzy steps in and propels the creature to the back of a mysterious ice cave. In the center is a dolmen with a bone sitting on it. Whoever touches the bone becomes docile and prehistoric in appearance. The Lemmings dream up a scheme where Grizzy would submit to their will.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (39/78)
programme.desc: When Grizzy goes fishing, the Lemmings jump on the opportunity to transform the cabin into a giant ice slide. Upon his return, the bear puts an end to the rodents' bobsleigh party and gets ready to savor his day's catch. But the Lemmings steal his fish and draw the bear outside the cabin. Grizzy must try to recover his lunch while protecting his territory from a rodent invasion.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (40/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy pinches a magic statue from the Lemmings that has the power to make objects appear in real life. All you have to do, is pin the photo of one's desires upon it. Too bad for the rodents' snow-bike! Grizzy replaces the vehicle's photo with the portrait of his beloved she-bear who stayed behind in Canada. Barely arrived in African, the she-bear disappears again, victim of the rodents' trickery. It is the outbreak of a bitter dispute.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (41/78)
programme.desc: Annoyed by the Lemmings' new magnetic train, Grizzy propels the whole lot of them far from the cabin. The rodents land in the neighboring hut of a sorcerer and a mysterious mask falls onto one of them, endowing him with the power of telekinesis. The Lemmings are thrilled! They return to the cabin to explore this new magic power. Perched upon pieces of furniture, they fly around the room to finish their life-size flying train game!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (42/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy chases after the Lemmings, who have loaded a jar of Yummy into their remote-control driven car. Where the bear gets to the gas station, he destroys the vehicle and recovers the chocolate spread. The rodents find little mini-cars and chase Grizzy all the way back to the cabin, where they trip him up and intercept the coveted jar. Helpless, the bear sets out after them, until he runs into a tank truck filled with Yummy.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (13/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy discovers that the frenzied "break dance" the Lemmings are doing is actually due to the fleas they are infested with. When Grizzy catches them too, it's panic all round! Grizzy is determined to eliminate the parasites, down to the very last one. The problem is his little roommates have no desire whatsoever to be treated...

programme.title: Moley - Season 1 (20/52)
programme.desc: When Moley and Dotty spot Old Coot sneaking around MoleTown, Dotty can’t resist following. Soon they discover his secret tunnel, but all is not what it seems.

programme.title: Moley - Season 1 (21/52)
programme.desc: When a mysterious sighting breeds rumors of aliens in Mole Town, Moley and Dotty investigate in hopes of finding the truth.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (1/52)
programme.desc: After accidentally derailing Gordon, Thomas promises to deliver Gordon's cargo to Whiff's Recycling Plant while racing with Diesel to get there first! As the competition gets heated and cargo is dropped, friends help Thomas pick up the pieces and remember that keeping the promise to Gordon is what will make Thomas the number one engine.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (2/52)
programme.desc: Thomas is excited about a rocket launch happening at Brendam Docks. When he’s tasked with delivering a small battery, he puts it off to help the other engines deliver the big exciting rocket pieces. But when Thomas gets to the rocket launch he realizes the only thing they’re missing is the battery - without it, the rocket can't take off! He'll need to race back to deliver the battery on time, or else the rocket will never launch!

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (3/52)
programme.desc: The lightbulb has gone out at the lighthouse and Percy is tasked with making a nighttime delivery of a new bulb to replace it. Percy is afraid of the dark, so Thomas makes up a fun game that he and Percy are 001 and 006 spies to help Percy cope with his fear along the way. Along the way the two friends will face the dark, and Percy might learn a thing or two about courage.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (4/52)
programme.desc: At Knapford Maintenance Yard, Thomas constructs his ideal obstacle course. However, none of the trains can do the course because Thomas only built it for his abilities and is adamant that they do it his way. The trains leave defeated and as Thomas goes to make amends with each of them, he sees them each using their unique strengths as they work. Thomas rebuilds the obstacle course to cater to the other train’s abilities, but will it be enough to repair their friendship?

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (5/52)
programme.desc: Annie and Clarabel have a nighttime delivery so they need to get to their destination that day well rested. Thomas volunteers to take them but must remain quiet to let them sleep the whole ride. Thomas has a really difficult time keeping quiet with lots of noisy impulses, places and things he passes, almost waking Annie and Clarabel. Thomas is eventually joined by Percy, and they even sing a lullabye, but they'll find out whether or not it's enough to last them the whole ride.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (6/52)
programme.desc: Thomas loves to race Kana. He uncharacteristically wins when her power goes out. Unable to move fast, she may not make it to her destination before sunset. Usually, Kana only takes the fastest route and everything goes by in a blur, but Thomas might be able to help her take things slow for a change.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (7/52)
programme.desc: It's Thomas's job to deliver a giant wooden dragon at the Medieval Faire at Kirk Ronan. The other engines want a turn, so they all compete to catch the dragon, pretending to be knights, thinking whoever catches it will get to deliver it. The engines are hurt when Thomas clears up the misunderstanding and would like the job to remain his. Thomas will need to learn that when he's working with a team, it's important to share the effort.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (8/52)
programme.desc: Thomas finds a map to the special Crystal Locomotive landmark in the Crystal Caves and forms a Big Adventure Club to go explore. Sandy wants to come but her friends say she’s a little too small to join. Instead, Sandy recruits Diesel to go with her instead as part of her Bigger Adventure Club. In the twists and turns of the mine, the Big Adventure Club find themselves lost. Now it's up to Sandy and Diesel to find the Crystal Locomotive and bring everyone home.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (9/52)
programme.desc: Thomas is nervous about taking a delivery to the mine so Percy generously gives him his lucky bell to take along. However, Thomas is careless with the bell and it falls down the mine. He tries to down play the loss, but Thomas will need to own up to his mistake before his friends help him get the bell back.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (10/52)
programme.desc: When Sandy learns about a massive shipment of sand that needs to be delivered, she is determined to help. But her size means she can't help Thomas tow the sand, so she finds other ways to help him. Along the way, Sandy accidentally gets Thomas' sand shipment wet, turning it to mud, and making it impossible to get over a mountain without spilling anything. However, Sandy is still determined to help Thomas complete his sandy delivery.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (1/78)
programme.desc: Findley can't resist some freshly baked cookies that are too hot to eat.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (2/78)
programme.desc: Avocado's new toy is driving everyone crazy with its noisy squeaker.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (3/78)
programme.desc: Lucas performs epic jumps all around House. Findley is nervous and wishes Lucas wouldn’t jump.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (4/78)
programme.desc: When Lucas and friends go camping, Avocado tells a scary story. Lucas now thinks there’s a ghost in the garden.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (5/78)
programme.desc: Lucas loves to give his friends a scare on Halloween.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (6/78)
programme.desc: When Lucas boops a robot, he and his friends are chased around House!

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (7/78)
programme.desc: Lucas wakes up in the middle of the night. How long can a night alone last?

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (8/78)
programme.desc: Lucas tries to beat Bodhi at Hide and Seek.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (9/78)
programme.desc: When Findley watches a show about spiders eating flies, he thinks Lucas wants to eat him!

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (10/78)
programme.desc: Lucas and Findley find an ice cube. When Lucas rides the ice cube in the sink and falls down the drain, a scared Findley rallies to save him.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (11/78)
programme.desc: Lucas questions his spider-hood when he can't spin a web properly.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (6/78)
programme.desc: When Lucas boops a robot, he and his friends are chased around House!

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (12/78)
programme.desc: When Arlo's mom is out, Lucas looks after him. How hard can it be?

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (13/78)
programme.desc: After hearing a screech from the fireplace, Lucas journeys up to find what is causing the noise.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (14/78)
programme.desc: Lucas and friends find a Gingerbread House and can't resist eating it.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (1/78)
programme.desc: Findley can't resist some freshly baked cookies that are too hot to eat.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (4/78)
programme.desc: When Lucas and friends go camping, Avocado tells a scary story. Lucas now thinks there’s a ghost in the garden.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (15/78)
programme.desc: Saying goodbye can be hard, but there are ways to feel close to your friends.

programme.title: Moley - Season 1 (22/52)
programme.desc: When everything seems to be going wrong for Dotty, she takes Manny out on an adventure and runs into the Gardener, who plots to steal him!

programme.title: Moley - Season 1 (23/52)
programme.desc: When Mishmosh’s lab is flooded, Moley invites Mishmosh to temporarily stay at his burrow. But when Mishmosh proves to be a difficult houseguest by turning Moley’s place into a makeshift lab, Moley’s patience is tested.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (19/52)
programme.desc: When Mr. Bean breaks his favourite Royal mug he discovers there's only one place to buy a replacement: Buckingham Palace, home of the Queen of England. When one of Her Majesty's corgis runs off with his teddy, Bean gives chase through secret tunnels… and gets lost.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (20/52)
programme.desc: When did Mr. Bean first meet his teddy bear? Did he really learn to drive his mini at the age of ten? Could he possibly have known his battle-axe of a landlady when she was a sweet and blushing bride? Bean takes us on a journey into the past, answering these questions and giving us an inkling as to what made him the man he is today.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (21/52)
programme.desc: Mr. Bean finds himself lumbered with an unwanted pet in the form of a four-legged ball of pink fur with piggy eyes and a penchant for earthworms. Encyclopedias leave him none the wiser as to the identity of the pesky creature but Bean can’t bring himself to just abandon it. The puzzle is eventually solved after a picnic in the park and a raid on the local pet shop.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (22/52)
programme.desc: Mr. Bean forgets the golden rule: never fall asleep in the bath when you've got a chicken in the oven. So what romantic meal can he quickly rustle-up for his luckless girlfriend, Irma Gobb? The cheese from the mousetrap? The flower from the vase? A meal is eventually provided by an uninvited guest.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (51/78)
programme.desc: Butch gets muscled out of his alley by a bullying runt of an alley cat and Tom, Jerry and Spike team up to help Butch win back his territory (and keep him out of theirs).

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (52/78)
programme.desc: Bedfordshire Bertie, a champion show horse, runs away and hides on the estate grounds, where Jerry does his best to help her hide from nosey Tom. Bertie is stressed out over a big upcoming meet, but Jerry has a calming effect on her. When Tom catches up with them, he, too, helps the horse overcome her nerves and get back to her old self.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (53/78)
programme.desc: A magician's hat is left behind at Ginger and Rick's house. Jerry runs into it, but when Tom reaches in after him, all he gets are multiple magician props. Tyke and Spike soon join in, and the top hat continues to wreak havoc.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (54/78)
programme.desc: In Catsylvania, a strange flying bug bites Tom, transforming him into a Tom-sized bug monster. Van Mouseling saves the village with an old-fashioned canister of bug poison, and Tom flies off to the abandoned castle on the hill. But Tom's troubles aren't over yet! Inside, he must deal with huge spider webs and a spider the size of a truck.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (55/78)
programme.desc: While mopping the kitchen floor, Tom uses an odd-looking sponge on a plate to clean up the mess. But the "sponge" turns out to be a rare truffle, which the estate's new pig ate. To pacify Cates, Tom and Jerry must find out whether the animal is also good at hunting truffles.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (56/78)
programme.desc: Ginger places her granny's old cuckoo clock in the hall, and it still works! However, the newly arrived clock causes issues when Tom wants to catch the tiny wooden bird inside and Tuffy wants to befriend it.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (57/78)
programme.desc: At midnight, a gothic lady cat appears with her favorite sinister plant creatures including her personal favorite: Fang, a big man-eating plant. As long as it's sealed in the hothouse, nothing can go wrong. But Tom, Jerry and Tuffy soon have their hands full with the escaped plant.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (58/78)
programme.desc: Cates appears and assigns Tom the job of sweeping the estate's chimneys, warning him not to upset the Duchess's new exotic pet bird. Unfortunately, both the pet bird and a stork at the top of the chimney think Jerry is a worm. Soon chaos breaks out, hurting Tom's cleaning efforts.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (59/78)
programme.desc: When Tom finds out he won a contest to be in a cat food commercial, his behavior turns smug. This irritates Jerry, who goes to great lengths to ruin the commercial shoot at the house as Tom struggles in his role.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (60/78)
programme.desc: Peter, a pretentious cheapskate poodle, demands that Tom and Jerry help protect his precious sapphire egg on a train journey but won't pay their fare. The cat and mouse become stowaways and go to a lot of trouble to do their job, but the outcome is unexpected.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (61/78)
programme.desc: As Jerry and Tuffy play marbles, Tom throws a soccer ball in their direction and upsets the game. This sparks a chase between Tom and Jerry, and Jerry takes cover in a room that looks like a giant chessboard. As more chess pieces show up, Tom and Jerry attempt their best to outplay them.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 2 (6/78)
programme.desc: Tom is determined to hijack the fun Jerry and Tuffy are having making paper airplanes, but the hijinks take a turn for the worse when Tom realizes he's made a paper airplane out of Ginger's great-great-grandmother's treasured fruitcake recipe.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (62/78)
programme.desc: After catching a crook, Tom and Jerry are framed, and the police chase them instead of the true criminal. Tom and Jerry must go on the lam as they try to avoid jail time.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (70/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy finds a birthday piñata in the ranger's living room. The idea of bursting open a papier-mâché statue with a bat like it says in the instructions pleases him. The Lemmings, who prefer to use it as a toy to swing from, are determined to stop Grizzy from destroying the piñata.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (71/78)
programme.desc: Inside a mysterious cave, Grizzy and the Lemmings discover a magical Game of the Goose. The events displayed in the squares that the players land on come true in real life. When Grizzy and the Lemmings realize, it's too late to stop the game.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (72/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy is bothered by an object stuck in between the sofa cushions: a big fur lemming puppet glove. He puts his hand inside and has fun pretending that the puppet is strangling him. The Lemmings believe that the puppet is a Super Lemming who's stronger than Grizzy and start to obey it.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (73/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy discovers the leftovers of a Halloween party in the ranger's cabin, which was entirely redecorated for the occasion, with stupefaction. But if the curious ambiance perturbs Grizzy, the Lemmings are in seventh heaven and have a whale of a time jumping up and down inside a cooking pot full of marshmallows. Grizzy wants to get rid of it until he accidentally swallows a marshmallow and discovers the best flavor of his life.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (74/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy wants to give the she-bear he's in love with a plastic ring which he finds really swell. But since the object was found in the trash, he needs to wash it first. And the Lemmings are using the sole bar of soap in the house as a bobsleigh.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (75/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy finds a strange American Indian figurine with the power to switch the spirits of two living beings and finds himself imprisoned in the body of a caribou. He immediately tries to activate the reverse procedure, but the Lemmings steal the figurine in order to turn into a partridge and fly away.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (76/78)
programme.desc: While salmon fishing on the riverbank, Grizzy hauls in an unusual catch: an old hand mirror straight out of a fairytale. Instead of showing the reflection of the person who holds it, the mirror shows an idealized vision of his surroundings. Whether it be Grizzy or the Lemmings, everyone sees the world of his dreams, and no one wants to share it.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (23/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings have decided to organize a race with two sand yachts they found on the beach. The only thing missing, is a worthy adversary. They put Grizzy, who was taking a nap, on one of the yachts without waking him up. And the race is off. Grizzy wakes up in shock onboard his sand yacht.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (24/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy has run out of ideas to open his coconut until he sees the Lemmings' new friend the crab open one with a simple snip of the claw. He confiscates the crustacean and uses it to take the tops off his coconuts. As they fight over the crab, the characters discover a remote-control device in a secret grotto that operates a giant crab. Grizzy takes over the controls, but the Lemmings want to play with the joystick too!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (25/78)
programme.desc: A helicopter takes off from the beach, leaving behind installations for a TV game, namely lots of food supplies – which are locked up. To access the keys and the food, participants must win team tests under the surveillance of a drone. The Lemmings are the yellow team. The red team is comprised of Grizzy, an oar, and a flabbergasted crab!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (26/78)
programme.desc: While trying to avoid the Lemmings' outboard speedboat, Grizzy punctures his air mattress and is propelled into a hidden grotto where he finds a conch decorated with Maori symbols that can control whales. Grizzy returns, proudly straddling his cetacean and chases the Lemmings from his peaceful spot. But the Lemmings' imagination is equal to the size of this potential new playmate!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (27/78)
programme.desc: While arguing over a jar of Yummy, Grizzy and the Lemmings happen upon a polar bear cub who is crying. When the little bear sees them, he wails even louder. Annoyed by his sobs, Grizzy and the rodents try to pacify him, but nothing works. After feeding and changing him, the baby finally falls asleep. How can they pick up their Yummy battle without waking the cub?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (29/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings have set up a long line of dominos in the cabin that ends with several giant ice blocks and a rocket outside. Weary of not finding the peace and calm he loves so dearly, Grizzy sabotages the game. The rocket hits an ice block and blows up the cabin. Grizzy gets his hands on a machine that can sculpt ice. The bear dreams of an igloo, but the Lemmings have other projects.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (50/52)
programme.desc: Mr. Bean finds himself in a race to grow a giant marrow with his next-door neighbour. There’s prize money at stake and a chance to get his photo in the papers. And so, as the competition gets tough, Bean’s gardening techniques become more ingenious, unconventional and desperate.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (51/52)
programme.desc: He’s got her record, the poster and the T-shirt, so when Mr. Bean’s heart-throb, Roxy, is set to sing in concert at the London Palladium, he sets his sights on the only thing that will make his life complete: her signature in his autograph book. A difficult feat but can love prevail?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (52/52)
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is over the moon when he meets Mr. Pod because both men have so much in common; same shirt, jacket, trousers and underpants. And to top it all, Pod is Bean’s spitting image! Bean falls to Earth with a bump, though, when his girlfriend, Irma Gobb, finds Mr. Pod much better looking than him.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 2 (1/52)
programme.desc: Mr Bean is unimpressed with a horror movie he sees at the cinema and reckons he can do much better. Bean sets out to create his very own home movie masterpiece –featuring Mrs Wicket Irma and Teddy! The screening in the garden is a huge success but will Mrs Wicket be pleased with her makeover and starring role?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 2 (2/52)
programme.desc: Mr Bean has to look after Mrs Wicket’s pet goldfish while she is away. With a ravenous Scrapper sniffing around Bean ends up becoming more bodyguard than babysitter. But when he manages to lose his fishy friend Mr Bean takes a nightmare journey down the sewer and back to his neighbour’s house via the park. Can Mr Bean get the pesky pet back in the bowl before Mrs Wicket returns home?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 2 (3/52)
programme.desc: Mr Bean wins two tickets for an exotic cruise and naturally he takes Teddy along for the trip of a lifetime. Once aboard the huge ocean liner Mr Bean soon settles into a life of luxury but while showing off to a new friend Bean becomes ‘man overboard’ and stranded on a dessert island. The hungrier he gets the wilder he becomes and desperate to find a way off the island.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 2 (4/52)
programme.desc: Mr Bean goes to his favourite china shop to buy a new cup for Teddy but when he opens his wallet he doesn’t have enough money to pay for it. When he sees a poster for the local funfair where the stalls have cash prizes Bean is determined to win himself some money on the Coconut Shy. But after many unsuccessful attempts he realises it’s a fix and lets everyone know about it. Naturally this doesn’t go down well with the stallholder who wants revenge and a chase around the funfair ensues.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 2 (5/52)
programme.desc: Mr Bean’s electricity supply is cut off when Mrs Wicket sees the cost of her enormous electricity bill. As the snow falls outside Mr Bean’s flat becomes so cold that there are ice cubes in his bath water. Mr Bean has the idea to build a huge wind turbine in the back garden providing his own power. All is going very well until an unexpected storm sends Bean’s wind turbine into overdrive creating a huge surge of electricity and a huge shock for everyone

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 2 (7/52)
programme.desc: Mr Bean is furious with the untidy state of the streets and all the people who drop litter so he goes on a one-man mission to clean up the town. Armed with several bin bags Mr Bean collects all the rubbish and puts up his own ‘No Littering’ signs - which have absolutely no effect. When the police show no interest in his campaign Bean builds a homemade vacuuming contraption causing chaos and mayhem wherever he goes.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (11/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy finds a magician's hat that tosses out objects stored inside beforehand with the tap of a magic wand. He decides to impress his beloved she-bear with a magician's act. But he will have to work around the Lemmings, who have the gift of coming out of the hat at the wrong moment.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (16/78)
programme.desc: A newly unpacked UV tanning booth holds the place of honor in the middle of the cabin. Grizzy gets it into his head that a classy tan will help him draw the attention of the she-bear he's enamored with. When he opens the box, he discovers that the Lemmings have beat him to it and are already playing "beach party" inside the bed.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (12/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy wants to try out the brand new packaging format of chocolate spread that he discovers in the ranger's cupboard: a yummy-looking XXL jar. And he does not intend to share it with the Lemmings. After observing a chameleon toad that is able to blend into its surroundings, the Lemmings decide to make themselves invisible to attain Grizzy's treasure.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (19/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings discover the joys of photography with the ranger's instant print camera. Grizzy would like to make a beautiful artistic portrait of the she-bear he's in love with, whereas the Lemmings prefer a group photo with a face-making competition: two radically opposed artistic trends!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (20/78)
programme.desc: The fridge in the cabin has changed: it's been replaced by a brand new state-of-the-art appliance which analyzes the body fat percentage of whoever wants to serve himself, before selecting the appropriate foodstuffs. For Grizzy, no question of touching the chocolate spread or sodas! Instead, to the Lemmings' delight, the fridge transforms into an extreme exercise machine.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (21/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy watches a demonstration of balloon modelling on TV. He decides to make a balloon poodle to offer to the she-bear he's enamored with. By observing Grizzy, the Lemmings discover with enthusiasm that you can blow up modelling balloons far more than regular ones, and that they end up exploding in a shower of tattered strips.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (22/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy needs a nice nap. He can't find a pillow comfortable enough to his taste until he tests the pillow that the Lemmings use as a high-jump mat. The pillow is so soft that Grizzy falls asleep the second he lays his head on it.

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (21/52)
programme.desc: The Clunky Card is very different from the other members of the Queen’s army of Cards. The monarch finally tires of its constant lateness, clumsiness and… crumpledness, and throws it out of her army! Appalled by this injustice, Alice goes all out to help recover the Clunky Card’s former status. But does one always necessarily have to be like everyone else in order to be accepted...?

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (22/52)
programme.desc: Alice comes bursting into Wonderland, eager to get Lewis to try out her new chewing-gums. But the rabbit swallows one sideways and now, every time he talks, gum bubbles come out of his mouth! In the Twins’ eyes, there’s only one cure: Alice must take Lewis to the wild orchard and feed him a fruit from the Balance-y Tree. Easier said than done: Lewis is releasing so much gum that they can’t see the trees for bubbles!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (23/52)
programme.desc: Alice brings a big shell back from vacation for Lewis. But when she gets to Wonderland, the Queen wants to keep it for herself! So Alice tells her that the shell is, in fact, her crown, meaning she too is a queen! Wonderland’s sovereign believes this fib and decides to coach Alice in the art of queenhood, or, more precisely, the Art of Being a Queen of Hearts! Lewis is deeply concerned, for good reason: Alice is playing along with the monarch so much that she’s actually starting to act like her!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (24/52)
programme.desc: Alice hears a noise in her room at night and gets scared. It’s Lewis, calling her from Wonderland: he needs to go to the Valley of the Night to harvest some new piano keys and he’s scared to go alone. Alice goes with. As they walk through the valley (where it’s constantly nighttime), they get spooked out by eerie noises… until they realize it’s just the dark playing havoc with their imagination. But when they get to the Nasty Trees, it’s a whole different story…

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (48/78)
programme.desc: The raccoons break into the Mikkelsens house again and Mike is easily defeated during a fight against the determined crooks. It's clear that fighting isn't his forte. Mike turns to the turtles to teach him the ancient art of karate so he can have a chance at defeating the rodents. Our determined pooch does his best but he just can't seem to get the hang of it. Time for Mike to ditch karate and resort to plan B.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (49/78)
programme.desc: Stephan upgrades the house's security system and it looks like Mike might be able to take a break from playing guard dog. The new system immediately detects when the raccoons are trying to break in and ejects from the property. Mike didn't even have to lift a paw. Unfortunately, the system works a little too well and quickly targets Mike as an intruder too. Now Mike and Freddy are on the same team trying to break in so he can defeat the errant security system and save Mercury and Fluffy who are still trapped inside.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (50/78)
programme.desc: The raccoons stumble upon an old whistle in the trash. Mercury blows it like a madman and the raccoons discover that it has strange powers over Mike. When Mike hears it, he instantly starts performing weird tricks. The raccoons have Mike right where they want him. Mike has to find a way to get rid of this new object of doom if he wants to get the raccoons out of the house and preserve his dignity.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (51/78)
programme.desc: Mike's got some company! A stray dog shows up at the Mikkelsens and the family is instantly impressed when he scares off the raccoons with a display of macho barking. Cassius is real guard dog material and it looks as though if Mike doesn't shape up he might be out of a job. When the racoons break in again Mike has a real fight on his hands to prove he's top dog.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (52/78)
programme.desc: Tom walks in and catches Mercury trying to break into in the garage. He thinks Mercury would make the cool, exciting pet he's always wanted. To Mike's horror, Tom makes him promise to make sure nothing happens to Mercury while he's at school. Mike, ever the obedient pooch, does his best but the turtles want Mercury out of the house. Mercury is making himself way too comfortable. Mike will need to use all his brainpower to kick the unwanted guest out of the house and enlists Freddy as an unlikely ally.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (53/78)
programme.desc: Louise draws a bunch of hearts and flowers on Mike during a makeup game. Mike sees the results and he's absolutely horrified. When Iris shows up, Mike has no choice but to hide. The raccoons take advantage of Mike's predicament to try to rob the house. Mike's only choice is to defeat the raccoons without being seen by anyone... especially Iris.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (54/78)
programme.desc: Mike, Iris and the turtles are playing a game of ping pong when a mysterious aged turtle arrives on the patio and gets hit by the ball. Mike and Iris take the poor injured turtle inside to recuperate, but all is not what it seems. The turtle is a master thief and his injury was all made up to steal a shiny Faberge egg from the Mikkelsen's house. Can Mike figure it out before it's too late?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (25/78)
programme.desc: A helicopter takes off from the beach, leaving behind installations for a TV game, namely lots of food supplies – which are locked up. To access the keys and the food, participants must win team tests under the surveillance of a drone. The Lemmings are the yellow team. The red team is comprised of Grizzy, an oar, and a flabbergasted crab!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (26/78)
programme.desc: While trying to avoid the Lemmings' outboard speedboat, Grizzy punctures his air mattress and is propelled into a hidden grotto where he finds a conch decorated with Maori symbols that can control whales. Grizzy returns, proudly straddling his cetacean and chases the Lemmings from his peaceful spot. But the Lemmings' imagination is equal to the size of this potential new playmate!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (27/78)
programme.desc: While arguing over a jar of Yummy, Grizzy and the Lemmings happen upon a polar bear cub who is crying. When the little bear sees them, he wails even louder. Annoyed by his sobs, Grizzy and the rodents try to pacify him, but nothing works. After feeding and changing him, the baby finally falls asleep. How can they pick up their Yummy battle without waking the cub?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (28/78)
programme.desc: A meteorite falls not far from the cabin. While the Lemmings are sledding outside on a metal pot lid, their sled is abruptly drawn to the extraterrestrial boulder. In seventh heaven, the rodents start over again, this time using the TV satellite dish. But Grizzy, determined to get the dish back at any cost, must confront the magnetism of the meteorite and the fury of the Lemmings, for the rodents are set on playing.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (29/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings have set up a long line of dominos in the cabin that ends with several giant ice blocks and a rocket outside. Weary of not finding the peace and calm he loves so dearly, Grizzy sabotages the game. The rocket hits an ice block and blows up the cabin. Grizzy gets his hands on a machine that can sculpt ice. The bear dreams of an igloo, but the Lemmings have other projects.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (30/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings find an ice block outside the log cabin that holds a frozen prehistoric animal: a saber-toothed racoon. Softened, the Lemmings free the creature and try to tame it like a kitten. But the raccoon is like a whirlwind. Grizzy wakes up and discovers the cabin topsy-turvy and flies into a rage. But when the bear tries to kick the rodents out, the wild raccoon challenges him.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (13/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy discovers that the frenzied "break dance" the Lemmings are doing is actually due to the fleas they are infested with. When Grizzy catches them too, it's panic all round! Grizzy is determined to eliminate the parasites, down to the very last one. The problem is his little roommates have no desire whatsoever to be treated...

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (26/78)
programme.desc: Mike's over the moon. Iris has invited him over for the cup of tea on her terrace. He's been waiting for this moment for weeks. But between the stress of the invite, and the other animals who are doing their best to drive him crazy... who knows if he'll make it on time or even in one piece for his date.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (27/78)
programme.desc: While Mike is distracted by flirting with Iris, the raccoons sneak into the house and begin mixing up a foul concoction in the kitchen. They spill the mixture everywhere and an unsuspecting Fluffy laps it all up. Poor Fluffy is instantly transformed into a psychotic ball of chaos. Fluffy has just become the raccoon's worst nightmare. Mike and the raccoons are going to have to join forces to defeat the ferocious feline.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (28/78)
programme.desc: If only Mike were a little bit more muscular, Iris would definitely look at him in a new light. At least that's what he tells himself when he sees Stephan's new workout bench. Unfortunately, it's not that easy. First, Mike needs to learn how to use it and the turtles and the racoons are doing everything they can to make the task more difficult. Muscles are one thing. Bruises are another.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (29/78)
programme.desc: Louise snaps a photo of Mike while they play a game together. The only problem is that Mike looks absolutely ridiculous in it. There's no way Mike can ever let Iris see it and he's going to do everything he possibly can to prevent the photo from falling into the wrong hands, but the raccoons have other ideas.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (30/78)
programme.desc: The turtles organize a sports contest and whoever wins gets a special trophy. Iris volunteers a reluctant Mike to take part in the games. Mercury joins in so he doesn't miss out on the fun. Mike's going to have to step up his game if he has any chance of beating Mercury, but he's not the only one who wants the trophy. Freddy has his eyes on it and he's not afraid to break the rules to get it.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (31/78)
programme.desc: The weather is miserable so Mike decides to stay in and catch up on his reading. However the book he's reading on Vampires is scarier than he bargained for. Pretty soon he's jumping out of his seat at every noise and squeak. When the racoons break in to the house try and raid the refrigerator for some rainy day snacks Mike decides to use his newfound knowledge of vampires to scare the pesky thieves right out of the house.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (32/78)
programme.desc: Mike has his work cut out for him when Stephan leaves a beautiful gift for his wife on the counter and goes to work for the day. The pesky raccoons decide to help themselves while the turtles fire up a huge game of Ice Hockey in the house and Fluffy also has eyes on the gift. Mike will need to pull out all the stops if he's going to rescue the gift from all the chaos.

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (49/63)
programme.desc: Squizel is being chased by the Dobermanns. He has stolen a necklace that he has hidden in an old doll and that Lola wants to give Lucie for her birthday. When Squizel comes to take the doll, Pat flies into action!

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (50/63)
programme.desc: In order to help her mother who is an architect,. Lola decides to construct something with toy, building planks (kapla). Except that the Guanos would just love to have them in order to renovate their own cabin. Pat is going to have to get the toy building planks back and make sure that Lola’s construction remains standing.

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (51/63)
programme.desc: Lola and Lucie go to the museum for their class presentation but find themselves locked inside. Pat will have to help them escape, while avoiding the Dobermanns who are guarding the museum.

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (52/63)
programme.desc: Hoodie sneaks into a haunted house. The Guanos have seen him go in. Lola wants to get the cat back but Victor tells her the house is haunted. Pat is going to help Lola recover Hoodie.

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (53/63)
programme.desc: For a homework assignment, Lola is going to make a diorama. The Guanos decide they want it for the film they are going to make. Pat is going to have to get the diorama back, in one piece.

programme.title: Pat the Dog - Season 2 (54/63)
programme.desc: Lola gets a bad mark in geometry and is afraid of telling her mother, the architect! The whole family goes bowling but Lola’s mother has to cut the game short and return home where she spots Lola’s geometry test. Before she can look at the grade, Pat is going to do everything he can so she doesn’t see it so that Lola can tell her mother herself.

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (33/52)
programme.desc: Convinced there’s an invisible spirit attacking the castle at night, the Queen orders Lewis to capture it. The rabbit does as he’s told and catches the “culprit.” But it turns out to be the Doormat Card: after being ignored for so long by all the people who wipe their feet on it, it had turned invisible! Now, all it’s trying to do is attract attention, from the Queen in particular! Alice and Lewis are going to help the Doormat Card get seen and appreciated by the monarch and its fellow cards. Mmm, easier said than done…

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (34/52)
programme.desc: Alice is annoyed: Carole and Bastien are hiding something from her. And when she goes to Wonderland, she discovers that Lewis has a secret from her, too, in the form of an origami butterfly; it flies away and hides inside a box of secrets in order to remain undisclosed. It’s Alice’s conviction, however, that friends should never have secrets from each other so she goes behind Lewis’ back and tries to get his butterfly out of the box to reveal its message. Unfortunately, not only does she free his secret, she also releases ALL of Wonderland’s secrets, in one go! Oh-oh…

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (35/52)
programme.desc: After getting struck by a lightning bolt courtesy of a grumpy magic cloud named Mr. Gray, the Queen and Lewis find themselves in a “swap-swap situation”: their bodies have been switched over! With Alice’s help, the Queen (in Lewis’ body), and Lewis (in the Queen’s body) must go and see Mr. Gray and get him to swap their bodies back again. But things get messy when all the Cards mistake Lewis for the Queen, and when Chester and Alice also become victims of a swap-swap!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (36/52)
programme.desc: Following a slip up, Alice accidentally erases all of Lewis’ memories about her. Now, the rabbit not only doesn't recognize her, he’s convinced he’s never even laid eyes on her before! Eager to get her bestie back, Alice sets about trying to make him relive various experiences they shared in the past. Unfortunately, this only gets him riled up and stressed!... Okay, the only way she’s going to be able to pull this off is by proving her friendship to him, undeniably!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis - Season 1 (10/52)
programme.desc: Wonderland is stuck in a time loop and only Alice and Lewis are aware of it! Teatime is a sacred moment, so having to repeat every 2 minutes can be very bothersome! Our two friends are going to have to be very smart and swift in order to handle the problem in record time.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (24/78)
programme.desc: By pure chance, Grizzy discovers the pleasures of video games on the ranger's console. The Lemmings want to try their hand at the joystick but Grizzy refuses to interrupt his Kart racing game. They try everything, including temptation, to get him away from the console but there's nothing doing, Grizzy is addicted.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (25/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy builds a look-alike robot to keep the Lemmings away while he prepares a popcorn party for his beloved she-bear. But his double¿s artificial intelligence truly leaves to be desired. If only it were as clever as the original...

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (26/78)
programme.desc: When she is accidentally hit over the head, the she-bear Grizzy¿s in love thinks she¿s a Lemming. Grizzy thinks that another little well-placed bang over the head will knock her ideas back into place. The only problem is that the Lemmings, who are delighted to have a new playmate, have no intention of letting him proceed with his plan.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (27/78)
programme.desc: When a meteorite falls not far from the log cabin, strange berries start to grow. One of their properties is that they make anyone who eats them grow to disproportionate sizes.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (28/78)
programme.desc: Under the wood floor of the log cabin, Grizzy and the Lemmings discover the entrance to an underground gallery with an old treasure card that indicates the location of a treasure. Upon closer look, the representation of this treasure greatly resembles a giant jar of chocolate spread.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (29/78)
programme.desc: When he brandishes a native american scepter that the Lemmings brought home with other antique objects, Grizzy sees the Lemmings bow low before him and behave like servants. One of them has escaped the spell, but he will have to confront both Grizzy and his fellow creatures in order to recover the scepter and reverse the spell.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (30/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy tries to impress the she-bear that he's in love with by making a sculpture of her from a piece of wood. But as soon as the artist's back is turned, the Lemmings gnaw at the work of art in order to transform it into a toboggan slide. Grizzy must succeed in getting rid of the Lemmings without his model realizing what's going on. An Art in itself!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (13/78)
programme.desc: A magic tomahawk divides Grizzy into two identical bears with diametrically opposite personalities: one short-tempered, the other super-sweet. The Lemmings, who did not witness Grizzy's split, will have a hard time working out the behavior of their usual enemy, who seems to swing from excessive kindness to the worst trickery for no reason.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (14/78)
programme.desc: Mike tries to brighten Iris's day by putting together an impromptu circus on the patio. Mike plays ringmaster as Fluffy pretends to be a wild tiger and the raccoons put on an acrobatic show. But the sticky-fingered raccoons want to steal Tom's pogo stick and ruin the circus. The show must go on!

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (15/78)
programme.desc: When Stephan brings a new robot into the house that looks exactly like Mike, he gets an idea. He can use the robot as his stunt double and impress Iris. But before Mike can put his plan into action the raccoons stumble across the robot as they try to break in and tie it up thinking it's Mike. Can the real Mike chase the racoons away without Iris discovering the fraud?

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (16/78)
programme.desc: It's sweltering outside and Mike has invited Iris onto the terrace for a cooling cocktail. But the raccoons steal the ice maker. A chase ensues and the ice maker ends up in the pool, transforming it into an ice rink. The turtles are in seventh heaven while Mike and the Raccoons fight for control of the ice maker. Hockey, Curling, Ice Skating... it's a Mike On Ice Special.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (17/78)
programme.desc: Mercury suffers a huge blow to the head while trying to break into the Mikkelsen's house. When he wakes up, to Mike's great surprise, he seems to be acting like a dog. Now our hero has a new ally... one who quickly turns into a rival when he starts to flirt with Iris. Things get even more complicated when Freddy plots to bring his brother back to his old self, and more importantly... his partner in crime.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (18/78)
programme.desc: Tom leaves his beautiful train set out in the house and the raccoons see it as a fantastic way to ship their loot back to their den. Mike has other ideas. He's not about to let the pair of pesky varmints get away with it. It's a showdown between the good, the bad and the Fluffy.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (19/78)
programme.desc: Mike comes up with new plan to win Iris's affection by showering her with a cascade of rose petals. To do it, he needs to borrow Stephan's leaf blower. The only snag is that the raccoons also want to use the leaf blower to rob the house and Fluffy can't resist getting on the act. Mike has to come up with a pretty crazy solution to win the day.

programme.title: Mighty Mike - Season 1 (20/78)
programme.desc: There's nothing better than a little magic trick to impress your crush. Iris isn't the only one impressed when Mike puts on a magic show and multiplies some objects with just a flick of his wand. The raccoons decide to steal his magic wand so they can turn their solitary chicken wing into a sumptuous feast. But the raccoons have underestimated Mike the Magic Trickster.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 2 (13/78)
programme.desc: After believing that Jerry has been eaten by a hungry bear cub, Tom must avoid the mama bear's wrath as he tries to retrieve his pal. Meanwhile, oblivious to Tom's plight, Jerry's enjoying the perks of circus life.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 2 (22/78)
programme.desc: Not wanting to miss a marathon of their favorite TV show, Butch and Meathead give Tom a fake treasure map in exchange for a little TV time. While they try to get comfortable in Rick and Ginger's house, Tom and Jerry must figure out a way to circumvent Spike when they realize his house is sitting directly atop their riches.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 2 (17/78)
programme.desc: Hildie sends Tom and Jerry into the woods to find a baby dragon who they befriend on their way home. But when Hildie tells them she plans on making the dragon into dinner, Tom and Jerry work together to save him.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 2 (27/78)
programme.desc: While Rick and Ginger are looking after their adorable niece for the weekend, Rick jokingly puts Spike in charge of keeping the kid safe while Ginger goes to the store. Taking his new job seriously, Spike swears that nothing will happen to the baby. Naturally, this is where Tom and Jerry arrive on the scene to wreak havoc and make Spike's babysitting job quite possibly be his last!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 2 (15/78)
programme.desc: When Hildie and Beatie believe they've had a few of their things stolen, they employ a little magic to create Bog, the Cottage Beast. In order to prove that Bog is overkill, however, Tom and Jerry must confess to borrowing the "stolen" goods to beat up on each other.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 2 (23/78)
programme.desc: Feeling bad for giving Tom's precious blanket to "Badwill," Jerry's determined to get it back. But with all the bizarre, enchanted items that have been donated over the centuries, getting anything back from Badwill is not easily done.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (43/78)
programme.desc: To recover the jar of Yummy that Grizzy confiscated from them, the Lemmings decide to infest the bear's coat with fleas. The scheme works and Grizzy starts scratching himself frenetically. Nonetheless, the bear manages to counter their diversion and expulse the rodents. When they land on a sorcerer's hut, the Lemmings take possession of a magic scepter that has the ability to temporarily shrink objects. Now microscopic-sized, the rodents return to the cabin to get their paws on the chocolate spread.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (44/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy wakes up starving but the cupboards are empty. While the Lemmings play nearby with an elephant, the bear swipes their peanut reserves. Not at all pleased, the rodents decide to recover their bag of nuts and use the elephant's trunk like a powerful vacuum cleaner to hurl all sorts of objects at Grizzy. In the heat of the battle, the Lemmings discover a pack of fabulous peanut and chili pepper cookies that seem to make the pachyderm ultra-powerful.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (45/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy is about to start eating the last remaining food in the cabin: cocktail snacks. But the sly Lemmings get there first. A fight breaks out but is quickly cut short by the unexpected visit of a wart hog. The pig devours the crackers and then, using his snout, detects a forgotten old package of candy under the bed, which he also proceeds to gobble down. Everyone realizes that the creature has the ability to find food. Grizzy and the Lemmings fight over who will follow the beast to track down food.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (46/78)
programme.desc: In order to win a trophy filled with Yummy candies, Grizzy and the Lemmings take part in a safari photo competition on an animal reserve. They must capture the portraits of a number of wild animals that live in the park. It requires all their cunning to approach the elephant, wart hog and bat and take photos for the contest. But when it comes to the super-speedy, blue-necked ostrich, it's a different kettle of fish!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (47/78)
programme.desc: While Grizzy organizes a picnic alongside the pond, the Lemmings steal his jar of Yummy using water balls to discreetly advance underwater. Despite their equipment, the bear surprises the Lemmings and traps the rodents inside a waterproof ball which he throws far into the distance. An ostrich mistakes the ball for her egg and sits on it, waiting for the egg to hatch. The Lemmings are adopted by this new mother who is prepared to do anything to satisfy her offspring!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 3 (48/78)
programme.desc: Chased by a raging elephant, Grizzy and the Lemmings are ejected from the cabin and land on a small nearby promontory. One of the rodents finds himself seated upon a throne-shaped boulder. A ray of sunlight illuminates him, and the savannah animals bow down before the Lemming king! But as soon as he leaves his royal seat, his powers disappear. Grizzy grabs the opportunity to plop down on the throne. Upon his orders, the other animals seek to provide him with every comfort, bringing the cabin, television and food closer. But the Lemmings put their feet down.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (14/78)
programme.desc: Another heat wave: even the riverbed is dried up. One very thirsty Grizzy discovers that the Lemmings have used the last remaining bottles of water to fill their inflatable pool. He has no intention of letting the Lemmings swim in what might very well be his last chance to quench his thirst.

programme.title: Moley - Season 1 (22/52)
programme.desc: When everything seems to be going wrong for Dotty, she takes Manny out on an adventure and runs into the Gardener, who plots to steal him!

programme.title: Moley - Season 1 (23/52)
programme.desc: When Mishmosh’s lab is flooded, Moley invites Mishmosh to temporarily stay at his burrow. But when Mishmosh proves to be a difficult houseguest by turning Moley’s place into a makeshift lab, Moley’s patience is tested.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (11/52)
programme.desc: Carly needs all the trains to help with a very big delivery - relocating three cottages to the other side of Sodor! They must work in pairs to deliver one cottage each. When Thomas gets paired with Diesel, he's sad he doesn't get to work with his best friend Percy, who is delivering another cottage with Nia. Can Thomas and Diesel complete their delivery or will Thomas be too distracted without his best friend?

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (12/52)
programme.desc: Thomas and Percy eagerly accept an assignment to deliver ten cows to McColl's Farm. Gordon warns the engines of the difficulty of this task but the trains don't pay attention, laughing and playing. Thomas and Percy do a final count of the cows at the farm and realize they're missing some! With Percy's help, Thomas searches Sodor to round up the herd and attempting to "play" attention as they do.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (13/52)
programme.desc: Thomas joins Nia on her way to big concert at Kirk Ronan. But when they arrive, they learn Gordon has not shown up with the instruments. Thomas and Nia track Gordon down, but Nia ends up getting stuck on the other side of a broken drawbridge. Devastated that she'll miss the concert, Nia tells the others to go on without her, but Thomas is determined to bring the concert to her. The show must go on!

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (14/52)
programme.desc: The trains declare it's backwards day at Knapford Station and have loads of fun doing everything backwards! Even Gordon reminds Thomas to do his deliveries backwards. But Thomas misunderstands and switches his deliveries instead. Now Thomas and Percy must track down the deliveries and get them to their proper homes. But they’re still determined to do it all… backwards!

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (15/52)
programme.desc: Thomas and Kana spot a rainbow and decide to find out where it could possibly lead, eager to find the prize that's always at a rainbow's end. However, as they chug along the rainbow keeps moving to a different location. Unsure if they'll ever catch the rainbow, many of their friends join the search, in hopes they'll finally reach their well-deserved prize.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (16/52)
programme.desc: Every year Sodor has a big parade and Nia has been tasked with delivering one of the giant balloon floats! She plans and calculates a route to avoid any error with the balloon but it's a really windy day and the balloon breaks free and floats away! Thomas, Carly, and friends all help Nia chase the balloon, but in order to catch it Nia will need to think on the spot for a change.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (17/52)
programme.desc: It’s the morning of the Train Day Festival and all the train kids are super excited to carry their very own, colorful flag in the train parade. Percy is eager to deliver each one to its rightful train but after rushing to make deliveries, he misplaces Nia's flag. Percy feels terrible, so he and Thomas retrace their steps to find it. And they do! Until it blows away, lost forever. They'll need to come up with a bright idea to replace Nia's flag before the festival begins.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (18/52)
programme.desc: Kana worries that a single charge is not enough for her to make a full journey. When she excitedly finds a mystery box with a clue, she heads off on a scavenger hunt with Percy and Thomas, tracking down multiple boxes. What road will this scavenger hunt lead them down, and could it be a solution to Kana's problem?

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (19/52)
programme.desc: Thomas acts as a bodyguard to assure the movie screen Nia's delivering arrives in pristine condition. Thomas is inspired by his favorite action hero, UltraTrain. In spite of Thomas' efforts, a speck of mud lands on the screen, and no matter what he and Nia do, it gets bigger and bigger! Thomas and Nia might need to come up with a unique solution before the movie night begins!

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Season 25 (20/52)
programme.desc: Thomas, Percy, and Nia have to make a delivery deep into the mainland but that means spending the night in a new shed along the way. But it's dark and there are so many scary sounds that Percy does not find it at all comforting like sleeping in Tidmouth Shed. With Thomas and Nia's help, Percy might be able to change his view and feel right at home.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (16/78)
programme.desc: Can Dimples finally beat Weebscuit at a staring competition?

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (17/78)
programme.desc: Lucas is convinced House is alive when the heating vent comes on.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (18/78)
programme.desc: Lucas, Findley and Bodhi become obsessed with a new toy called Boingo.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (19/78)
programme.desc: Findley is convinced House is out to get him.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (20/78)
programme.desc: Arlo is missing his mother, so Lucas gives him a bell to ring if he needs Lucas’s help – bad idea.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (21/78)
programme.desc: “Maizie” keeps ignoring Lucas and Findley, but not only do they learn she has a cousin, they also learn a new skill!

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (22/78)
programme.desc: Lucas befriends a bright purple toy spider, and Findley gets jealous.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (23/78)
programme.desc: Lucas and Findley move into the dollhouse together.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (24/78)
programme.desc: Lucas tries to help Bodhi fulfill her newfound dream of touching a star.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (25/78)
programme.desc: Lucas finds an egg and decides to take care of it. But he learns that responsibility is hard.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (26/78)
programme.desc: When Avocado loses her beloved toy, Lucas and Findley are determined to cheer her up.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (7/78)
programme.desc: Lucas wakes up in the middle of the night. How long can a night alone last?

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (27/78)
programme.desc: Findley discovers a boot that him and Lucas use as a castle.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (28/78)
programme.desc: When they hear Avocado has been put in her naughty crate, Lucas and Findley entertain her.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (29/78)
programme.desc: Lucas brings Dimples things from around the house so she doesn't feel left out.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (2/78)
programme.desc: Avocado's new toy is driving everyone crazy with its noisy squeaker.

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (6/78)
programme.desc: When Lucas boops a robot, he and his friends are chased around House!

programme.title: Lucas the Spider - Season 1 (30/78)
programme.desc: After watching Findley in flight, Lucas wonders what it would be like to fly.

programme.title: Moley - Season 1 (24/52)
programme.desc: After the Gardener is injured attempting to steal Manny, Moley volunteers himself and his friends to nurse the curmudgeon back to health—driving him bonkers in the process.

programme.title: Moley - Season 1 (27/52)
programme.desc: It’s the annual MoleTown Races, and each of the residents have their own unique car to compete for the grand prize. But how will Moley cope when he finds out there are no rules?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (23/52)
programme.desc: The nasty tennis player is big and angry and wants his ball back. The one Mr. Bean managed to throw on the roof of a house across the road. Paralysed with vertigo sixty feet up on a windowsill, he is eventually brought to earth by the helpful intervention of a neighbour’s pet gerbil.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (24/52)
programme.desc: Bean’s sweet tooth leads him to despair when he bites off a bit more than he can chew. He is tormented by the toothache from Hell - and embarks on a hilarious mission to pull out this menace. Bean’s DIY attempts fail to succeed, and he is left with no other choice but to visit the dreaded dentist. But can Bean brave the Dentist’s chair? Or will the dentist despair when faced with Bean’s antics?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (25/52)
programme.desc: After (accidentally) rescuing a kitten from a tree Mr. Bean is set to have his picture in the newspaper! The photographer arrives with the grateful lady cat owner, the scene is set, smiles all round…but then disaster strikes when Bean is continually upstaged by… his hair.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series - Season 1 (26/52)
programme.desc: As Mr Bean settles down to watch his favourite TV programme he hears loud noises from next-door. He moves from house to garden but can’t escape the relentless cacophony of trumpets, electric drills, and screaming babies. Bean’s mind turns to thoughts of revenge….

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (63/78)
programme.desc: Because of an injured foot, Rick stays home with Ginger's mother, Rosemary, taking care of him. Rosemary brings her infamous fat-free-dairy-free whole wheat gravy, and she quickly puts Rick, Spike and Tom on nutritious diets. Antics and fights break out as Rick and the pets crave real food.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (64/78)
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry take a case for Toodles' cousin in Hawaii, hoping to sneak in some rest and relaxation, but it's no vacation. The cousin's missing pineapple plant is only the starting place of the investigation as Tom and Jerry track down the culprit in this tropical environment.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (65/78)
programme.desc: Tom is chasing the mice around the haunted house when midnight strikes, and he finds himself face-to-face with a green-faced beast who's just as surprised to encounter Tom. It's soon revealed to be Toodles, who's a good witch brewing magic beauty products. Although Tom is enchanted at first, things stop going smoothly when he helps with her potions.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (66/78)
programme.desc: After entering Tyke in an agility contest, Spike sets up a course for the puppy in the backyard. Soon, Spike decides the course isn't hard enough and gets Tom to help, bending Tom into pretzel-like positions for Tyke to leap over, through, or into. After all this preparation, Tyke must still make it to the competition on time.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (67/78)
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry take a case from a mother tortoise to find out where her son Seymour is sneaking off to at night. They discover Seymour is self-training to win a championship boxing match, planning to pay off bills with the prize money so his mom can quit the car wash. When he offers Tom and Jerry a cut of the money to keep his secret, they take it and agree to train him—but it won't be easy.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (68/78)
programme.desc: Ginger and Rick's vegetable garden is growing, and they need a way to keep out the gophers. Ginger says traps are cruel, but Tom can handle the task! However, things start getting out of hand when a lady gopher falls in love with Jerry, and the two plan a garden raid together.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (69/78)
programme.desc: Skullie tells Tom that he won't have to sweat a visit from one of the spooks tonight. However, Tom is soon drawn to a full-length mirror that causes no shortage of trouble. As he gets pulled into the mirror, an evil reflection cat trades places with him. Tuffy and Jerry enter the mirror world too and must fight their reflection selves for survival.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (70/78)
programme.desc: When Stinker, the trash-loving dog, comes by looking for help, Tom and Jerry aren't inclined to take the case until they hear it involves a missing fortune. So, they're disappointed when they find out Stinker is searching for a lost fortune cookie from his Chinese takeout to learn his fate. Retracing the dog's steps, they chase the fortune cookie's trail through town.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (71/78)
programme.desc: After Tyke digs up, Hammy, Spike's lucky bone, Spike reburies it right away because it's bad luck to remove it. Soon afterward, Tom gets a set of toy dog bones that do tricks, and he teases Spike and Tyke with them. When the whirly-bone buries itself and unearths Hammy for a second time, Spike recruits the other animals to help prevent the bad luck he expects.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (72/78)
programme.desc: A ghost paints a flattering portrait of Tom, but Tom is stingy with his payment and the ghost casts a spell on the portrait. Strange things start happening as the portrait absorbs injuries and calories that should be affecting Tom. However, soon Jerry and Tuffy figure out what's going on and use it to their advantage.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (73/78)
programme.desc: When Rick and Ginger are asked to dog-sit for a friend's French poodle, Sabrina, Tom is initially on his guard, but soon he's practically eating out of her hand. Next, Spike falls for Sabrina and does everything he can to impress her with how kind he is to Tom. How long will everyone's behavior be affected by Sabrina's presence?

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 2 (1/78)
programme.desc: Ginger brings home a kitten that she will foster until she finds it a forever home. Everyone in the house falls in love with the kitten, except for Tom. When Spike and Jerry see that Tom has become a bad influence on the kitten, a dragged-out fight ensues. The only thing that ends it is the news that the kitten has a new home.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show - Season 3 (74/78)
programme.desc: Tom, Jerry and Tuffy have a run-in with a moving suit of armor. The knight scares Tom away, but Jerry makes a brave stand because he thinks the knight is Tom in disguise. Jerry eventually trips the suit of armor and finds out it's inhabited by three kittens. Relieved at first, the pets soon realize that battling one haunted knight is nothing compared to battling three real-life kittens.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (77/78)
programme.desc: In a casing that fell from a circus caravan, the Lemmings find a magic stick that can enchant objects and make them come alive. Grizzy is sure that a stick like that would save him a lot of work, the only problem is how to get it from the Lemmings, who have become sorcerer's apprentices?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 1 (78/78)
programme.desc: Whilst trying to stop the Lemmings from playing with a crate of firework rockets, Grizzy is literally carried away with them when the largest specimen shoots off. When the entire crate of fireworks explodes with a boom, they are hurled out of the atmosphere and all the way to the moon.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (1/78)
programme.desc: With their endless battles over the ranger's cabin which they do not want to share, Grizzy and the Lemmings end up blowing the cabin up. Amidst the debris, they discover a strange pack: an army tent with all the necessary equipment to recreate a home in nature. It's the chance to discover the joys of camping in the wild.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (3/78)
programme.desc: Grizzy gets rid of the Lemmings by crushing them with one of the ranger's heavy trunks, which he immediately clears out of the cabin, his enemies stuck to it like stickers. What he doesn't know, is that the trunk contains a multifunction drone, complete with joystick and virtual reality headset, which enables "embedded" piloting. Thanks to this cutting-edge technology, the Lemmings decide to regain control of the situation!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (18/78)
programme.desc: A strange object is delivered to the Ranger's cabin: an over-board! It's a latest generation skateboard which levitates above the ground without wheels. The Lemmings immediately try to get their paws on it, but Grizzy also covets the board as a table to set his TV-dinners down on.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (2/78)
programme.desc: The Lemmings encounter a white bear which has drifted all the way to them on a chunk of ice which is slowly melting. The bear makes a fabulous rodeo partner, he just needs enough ice to keep cool. Even a few ice cubes on his head are enough. The only obstacle to this beautiful friendship is Grizzy, who considers himself master of the fridge and thus of the cabin's ice production.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings - Season 2 (14/78)
programme.desc: After studying a magazine advertisement with a couple standing in front of an SUV, Grizzy imagines that if only he had a nice car, his favorite she-bear would be interested in him. He decides to confiscate the Lemmings crate on wheels and give it a serious overhaul. The Lemmings have nothing against an upgrade, as long as they remain behind the wheel!
